summary: Changes to the College of Winterhold Arch-Mage quarters to improve quality of life for those actually using it as a player home.
descriptionHtml:
[b]Introduction[/b]
The purpose of this mod is to change the Arch-Mage Quarters in the College of Winterhold to make it more practical and realistic for those using it as a player home. This is a first mod and by design it makes minimal changes. The Arch-Mage Quarters is a very cluttered frame-rate intensive space it does not need a mass of mannequins, bookshelves and furniture added to it. However some aspects of the original design are very unimaginative - just how many tables with two chairs does one person need?? 

In making changes the philosophy behind this mod is to offer those using the Arch-Mage area as a home, small quality of life improvements, that are lore-appropriate for an Arch-Mage and do not significantly impact gameplay. It is also a design principle that given how cluttered the area is, that in order not to impact performance, where items are added to the area this should be balanced by deletion of others. 

[b]Warning[/b]
[color=red]This mod replaces the following storage:
[list][*]Sack and Barrel near Alchemy desk
[*]Barrel and ALL the sacks on the edge of the garden area[/list]
And the following furniture
[list][*]Chairs and table opposite the wardrobe[/list]
[b]BE SURE AND REMOVE ANY ITEMS YOU WANT TO KEEP FROM THESE CONTAINERS BEFORE DOWNLOADING THIS MOD OTHERWISE THEY WILL BE PERMANENTLY LOST[/b][/color]

[b]Summary[/b]
This mod makes the following minor tweaks:
[list]
[*]General Purpose vendor (College Treasurer) added to the area enabling quick purchase and selling off items. Occasionally sells black soul gems. It is my intention the frequency reflect their status as rare and expensive objects and is likely to be subject to further tweaking.

[*]A small desk with writing implements and a few appropriate items upon it to increase immersion including a small box to store documents. 

[*]Labelled storage around the Alchemy and Enchanting stations. For RP purposes I can never think of a sack as a suitable container for multiple types of ingredient thus I prefer not to use those or barrels. Equally the satchels tend to prove fiddly. Hence a discrete chest on the bottom shelf near the alchemy table. There is also a small box for storing soul gems above the Enchanting table. 

[*]Other organized storage is included in a book shelf loaded with chests against a wall, replacing a table. This includes one NON-SAFE chest, ie the items in eventually respawn, which has some special mage items for enchanting. These are low-value clothing items with zero armor rating and so will not endanger the mage armor perk. There are two sets of hand wear, a version of the gloves used in the Out of Balance quest and one resembling Daedric Gauntlets for the mage in need of something fiercer looking. Both these can be enchanted, removing a major difficulty for mages the lack of availability of anything which they can wear on their hands which they can enchant. Just for good measure I have included a non-enchanted version of the Arch-Mage robes should anyone wish to put their own alternative enchants on it. 

[*]Reception Desk added in corridor area which is jointly staffed by a new Receptionist NPC and a Security Guard NPC at different times. No longer can people interrupt the Arch-Mage without warning.

[*]I have included one mannequin which by default shows the Arch-Mage\'s robes.
[/list]
Version 2 of this mod introduces additional storage area. Currently it is not intended to make any more changes to the original Arch-Mage quarters area.

[b]Recommended Other Mods to use with this one[/b]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=766]Archmage variants[/url] (best-looking of the alternative Arch-Mage robes)
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7484]Sexy Winterhold College [/url](retextured college)
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=746]No NPC Greetings (Reduced distance version)[/url] (makes all npc interactions less spammy)

[i]Compatible With[/i]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9053]Drakespire Arch-Mage\'s Office[/url]

[b]Possible Future Changes[/b]
Conversion of one or more of the new NPCs to followers
Additional students in college to walk to reception area and through college areas
Extra Scenarios including ones with substantial book storage and full crafting facilities

Please note I am not an artist and have no access to retextured work. The bench might not be the most appropriate set up for the desk but it is one of the few structures which allows backing out. I have not been able to find any true desks in game, even those in the Thalmor embassy are actually cupboards with pretensions. 

[b]CHANGES MADE BY THIS MOD:[/b]
Alters the vendors levelled list in order to enable black soul gems to be sold
Deletes 5 sacks, 3 chairs and 2 barrels from the Arch Mage area
Deletes 1 bench from the corridor area of the Arch-Mage quarters

Reuses a number of major lore figures and items. Hence has the potential to break quests though it has been carefully handled and precautions taken. Please report any problems

[b]KNOWN BUGS[/b]
Book script activates regardless of position in Arch-Mage quest chain. Will be corrected to work only after you have become Arch-Mage in a future release.
author: Malevolent Hospitality

files.name: MH_ArchMageQuartersMinimalMod_1_0_1
files.changelogHtml:
A small desk with writing implements addedA non-functioning mannequin
A non-functioning mannequin with Arch-Mage robes on it added
One sack removed. Replaced by nearby Alchemy Chest
Strongbox added above enchanting table for soulgems

files.name: MH_ArchQuartersMinimal Mod
files.changelogHtml:
Reception desk added in corridor area of quarters
Security Guard and Receptionist NPCs added who share responsibility for staffing the desk
AI of College Treasurer refined and she now walks throughout the quarters
Treasurer now occasionally sells Black soul gems
Change in Ambient sound whilst within the Arch-Mage area

files.name: MH_ArchMageQuartersMinimalMod1_2_0
files.changelogHtml:
Mannequin now functioning normally
Bookshelves with chests for more organized storage added
Special respawning chest with enchantable mage items added

files.name: MH_ArchMageQuartersMinimalMod_2_0_1
files.changelogHtml:
Added in missing Scenario description
Corrected a levitating table

files.name: MH_ArchMageQuartersMinimalMod
files.changelogHtml: Corrects accidental duplication of certain NPCs

files.name: MH_ArchMageQuartersMinimalMod3
files.changelogHtml:
Adds new scenario with categorized bookcase storage
Corrected an issue with two tables floating in the void
